RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States Court of Appeals for the F: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that made unassailed findings and oral findings of fact regarding the constitutionality of the stop and search, also referencing the Brignoni-Ponce standard in its decisions, and gave a modified Allen charge to the jury
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency involved in border surveillance, smuggling interception, and immigration inspections, with agents making stops based on reasonable suspicion, including factors such as vehicle appearance and passenger behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: appellate court considering the suppression motion on its merits, articulating principles for investigatory stops near the United States-Mexican border, and relying on an agent's observation, also providing guidance on probable cause to search vehicles, and upholding the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: a legal case involving a challenge to the modified Allen charge given to the jury
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: an international border relevant to immigration and smuggling cases, with its proximity being a factor in justifying investigatory stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: a highway where smuggling and illegal alien traffic have been reported, leading directly to the United States-Mexican border but passing through several towns, and a location of an investigatory stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: a legal case referenced in determining the justification for investigatory stops, and rejecting a general attack on the Allen charge as being inherently coercive
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: a legal case referenced in determining the justification for investigatory stops, and affirming the rejection of a general attack on the Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: a legal case referenced in determining the justification for investigatory stops, and upholding the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country of origin relevant to immigration and smuggling cases
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce standard: legal standard guiding reasonable suspicion for investigatory stops near the border
